knimeNode.name: FeatureCounts
knimeNode.shortDescription: featureCounts: an efficient general purpose program for assigning sequence reads to genomic features

fullDescription.intro:
featureCounts: an efficient general purpose program for assigning sequence reads to genomic features
For details, please see paper:
Liao et al, Bioinformatics 2013; doi: 10.1093/bioinformatics/btt656
featureCounts: an efficient general purpose program for assigning sequence reads to genomic features

tab.name: level 0 and 1 options
tab.option: Path to the compiled featureCounts binary. Theoretically all versions starting from 1.4.3 should be supported.

Can be used to set parameters which can not be set directly in this node.
Expected syntax: parameterName (with '-' or '--') parameterValue(s)
Example: --runThreadN 4
Parameters can be set like you would normally use them on the command line for this binary. This parameters override the settings in the parameter file and are overridden by the settings of level 2.

tab.name: level 2 options
tab.option: Path where the output file should be stored.
GTF or SAF annotation files are supported.
Feature type which is used for counting when GTF file is used. Default: exon
Counts also reads, which do not map uniquely
Number of threads which are used for counting. [1-16]

ports.inPort: Cell 0: One or more SAM or BAM files
ports.outPort:
Cell 0: path to output file
Cell 1: command which was used to call the binary

views.view: Shows the STDOUT and STDERR output of featureCounts when it was executed successfully.
